rationale: The segment uses neutral language without high-potency verbs or potent metaphors.
Uses 'were working' (plain verb), not a moderate verb + scale.
The segment does not contain a loaded rhetorical question.
The segment reports details of the latest cases, lacking explicit calming language.
The segment does not contain a minimiser used in conjunction with a scale contrast.
Provides details about cases/exposure, not capability or preparedness.
The segment reports case location/group/exposure, not prices, economic data, or numerical metrics.
The segment describes who was infected, not speculation about future relief or improvement.
Authorial statement provides factual description of cases and exposure.
Factual reporting of case location/group and exposure type without explicit framing cues.
